Here you will find two folders, one containing the phenotypic scripts
('ENIGMA-brainage-local.zip' —\> derives Han’s brain age gap phenotype)
and another one genetic ('ENIGMA-brainage-GWAS-local.zip' —\> runs the
BAGHan ENIGMA GWAS).   
  
<u>1. Phenotypic scripts</u>  
Please refer to the 'instructions' folder in ENIGMA-brainage-local,
which will guide you through the entire analysis. The most
time-consuming step is preparing the Covariates.csv file and the 3
FreeSurfer files. The actual analysis itself is very quick, as long as
the input files have been formatted appropriately.  
  
Link to phenotypic
folder: <u>[ENIGMA-brainage-local.zip](https://computingservices-my.sharepoint.com/:u:/g/personal/vb506_bath_ac_uk/EY9-ZdHveilOjpgX0QGjk_QB5KyHa_2XjfwtOaBozr8Tjw?e=k0o5Gd&&sdata=V1QvNmwvZDlheWwybkE5M1hnNUxzakt5WjVuUDM4RVk3bFB5TWVqaXZKZz0%3d)</u>  
  
<u>2. Genetic scripts</u>  
Once the phenotypic analysis has been completed, you can proceed with
the GWAS. Please follow the instructions in
'0.BrainAgeGWAS_genetic_analysis_instructions_20241216.docx'.  
  
Link
to GWAS folder: <u>[ENIGMA-brainage-GWAS-local.zip](https://computingservices-my.sharepoint.com/:u:/g/personal/vb506_bath_ac_uk/EWb5kdG2OshFrNvS8M_sToMBJ_xHr3XRbqSTrkgKCEHxcg?&sdata=elBPRG4xVkE1bUhDOTgzWTlIdHM4VkN5WUlZOXNEZ0pGcEFxeHpXQmVmbz0%3d)</u>  
  
Note, both folders are ~1 GB as they include Singularity containers.   
  
  
For UK Biobank–specific code for brain age estimation and GWAS see
https://github.com/pjawinski/enigma_brainage
